awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  A Student Learning Dashboard
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader/commercial impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project is in improving retention in higher education and increasing graduation rates. Currently, the average U.S. college dropout rate is 40%. Moreover, underserved Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) student populations are more likely to leave school without a degree. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, increased financial insecurity and mental health challenges have negatively impacted student learning. This project aims to develop a student learning dashboard platform that acts as a co-pilot during students' higher education learning journey by delivering targeted, personalized, and real-time actionable assistance. The solution holistically identifies each student's unique learning motivation challenges (e.g., subject difficulty, relevance to career goals, social and economic constraints, etc.) and provides specific recommendations to overcome barriers. Coaching students to learn how to learn more effectively based on their own context fosters a growth mindset, grit, and agency to help them become successful lifelong learners.  The application also significantly improves diversity, equity, and inclusion in higher education, especially in STEM, and thus increases effective workforce training. 

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project uses machine learning to understand each student's unique learning challenges, map how barriers affect learning motivation, and influences coursework engagement. Machine learning is applied to analyze qualitative and quantitative learning motivation and behavior data to identify gaps so real-time, targeted, and relevant guidance can be delivered while the students are still progressing through the courses rather than waiting until it might be too late for intervention. This project provides descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive recommendations to simulate one-on-one, personalized advising at scale and at a lower cost. The technology also acts as an early detection system when students show the first sign of academic and non-academic struggles affecting their mental state of readiness to learn. When in-person human intervention is required, instructors, academic advising, and/or relevant on-campus student support services can be alerted. This project can be used by any educational institution or private company providing in-person, flipped/hybrid, remote, synchronous, or asynchronous instruction formats.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Prenostik is developing a scalable AI-partnered human intervention Student Learning Dashboard (SLD) Software-as-a-Service tool to improve higher education graduation rates, especially among underserved communities. The SLD identifies student learning motivation and behavior gaps, provides real-time personalized guidance, and prioritizes those who need human intervention for student success.  

The Prenostik Student Learning Dashboard (SLD) leverages the research-based Expectancy-Value-Cost learning motivation model and acts as a 24/7 real-time copilot guiding students' learning journey. It holistically identifies each student's unique learning motivation and behavior challenges, provides relevant, automated real-time and target recommendations to overcome the barriers, and, as needed, immediately refers to professionals for assistance. Coaching students on how to learn effectively by fostering a growth mindset, grit, and agency will help them become successful lifelong learners and prepare them for the continuously evolving future workforce demands. The SLD can be used with small to large, in-class, flipped/hybrid, or online instruction formats.

Thanks to the NSF SBIR Phase I funding, Prenostik achieved the following three objectives:

1.     Prenostik developed a cloud-based software prototype integrated with a partner higher education institution's Learning Management System to track student learning behavior (e.g., assignment clickstream and due dates, etc.) and presented the information to students and instructors to improve self-awareness and self-regulation learning.

2.     In collaboration with the partner higher education institution's IT team, Prenostik developed an Extraction, Transform, and Load (ETL) Data Integrator engine to ensure student data security and privacy, adhering to standards such as the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) and Service Organization Control Type 2 (SOC2) compliance.

3.     Prenostik's higher education partner institution subaward project developed the Student Readiness Survey (SRS) to assess student learning motivation on subject difficulty, the relevance of the course topic, and non-academic stressors that may impede success. The SRS is intended to be a regular polling instrument given to students during each class session to assess student state of mind and to inform when and what type of automated AI and/or human intervention is needed.

Looking ahead, Prenostik is committed to further expanding testing and gathering additional student learning motivation and behavior data and feedback at other higher education institutions to inform and train AI to provide real-time, relevant, and targeted AI-partnered human intervention. Knowing specific student motivations and behavior challenges unique to everyone, the Prenostik SLD fosters lifelong learning skills that improve education equity among underserved communities and meet future workforce demands, all of which help increase the United States' technology and economic competitiveness in the world. 


Last Modified: 09/03/2024
Modified by: Patrick Hong
